reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Basic country motel, large room, double & single bed, small table with 2 chairs, large bench with other 2 chairs. Fridge, microwave, toaster & jug. Bathroom a bit cramped but shower is walk in with good water pressure. Has outside gas bar b que & sitting area. In central spot to walk around town. Dining room was part of the old pub and meals ok. Breakfast was in room only.
reviews.title: OK for a short stay

reviews.text: Nothing too fancy about this place but the rooms were large and the bed comfortable. Decor was dated but it was very clean and tidy. Room rate was good and the place is extremely well situated right in the middle of town. So its a good base to explore this gem of a town.
reviews.title: Nice town, nice motel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The motel behind the historic building is a pretty typical motel of the 70s or 80s. There are some nice outdoor areas but the room was small, dark because of the brick walls and pretty average. The double bed was adequate with the standard 4 pillows and a bedcover that I've seen in many other Australian motels, and starting to look a little worn. The veneer on the bathroom bench was chipped, the towels thin, the toilet not dual flush (really outdated in this day and age). The person on the front desk was pretty indifferent and could not be described as interested in us or pleased to see us. No fresh milk was offered though mugs were supplied in the room. Hooray! One wine glass was not clean. The only bed lighting was a flourescent globe over our heads - I hate this. It was expensive for what it was.
reviews.title: Nothing Put of the Ordinary

reviews.text: My husband attends a hang-gliding comp in Gulgong every year and he just camps at the airstrip. I decided to head out and spend a couple of days with him as I have never been to Gulgong before. As we had a 4.5 month old, we weren't going to camp, so we checked in here for the night. The rooms were spacious and had eveything we needed. Was basic and a little out dated but was comfortable. The air con was quiet and there were foxtel movies for free. Was right in the centre of town so we could walk to the shops and to get dinner and breakfast, very handy. The staff were friendly and helpful. Gulgong is a great little town and this is a great place to stay!
reviews.title: Country Charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This motel is comfortable, clean, and right on the main street in the middle of town, but still quiet. So, yep, its a great choice for a night or two in Gulgong.
reviews.title: Comfortable motel in a fascinating town
